lines.text:
[singing]
Just because I cannot see it, doesn't mean I can't believe it!

[singing]
My dearest friend, if you don't mind... I'd like to join you by your side. Where we can gaze into the stars...
And sit together, now and forever. For it is plain, as anyone can see. We're simply meant to be.
I am the shadow on the moon at night / Filling your dreams to the brim with fright.
Haven't you heard of peace on earth and goodwill toward men?
NO!

[singing]
What will become of my dear friend? / Where will his actions lead us then? / Oh, how I'd like to join the crowd / In their enthusiastic cloud. / Try as I may, it doesn't last. / And will we ever / End up together? / No, I think not. / It's never to become, / For I am not the one.
Sally! You came back.
I had to.
For this.
[holds Sally's detached arm; she causes it to wave at herself]

[smiles]
Yes.
Shall we, then?
We've got to find Jack! There's only 365 days left until next Halloween!
[first lines]

'Twas a long time ago, longer now than it seems in a place perhaps you've seen in your dreams. For the story you're about to be told began with the holiday worlds of auld. Now you've probably wondered where holidays come from. If you haven't I'd say it's time you begun.
Santa?
Merry Christmas! And what is your name?
Uh... uh...
That's all right. I have a present for you, anyway. There ya go, sonny! Ho ho ho! HEEHEEHEE!
[slips out the chimney]
And what did Santa bring you, honey?
[kid shows parents his present - a shrunken head; parents scream]

[flying away]
Merry Christmas!

[singing]
There's children throwing snowballs / instead of throwing heads / they're busy building toys / and absolutely no one's dead!
Jack, please, I'm only an elected official here, I can't make decisions by myself!
And one more thing...
[stops Barrel from leaving]
leave that no-account Oogie-Boogie out of this!
Whatever you say, Jack.
Of course, Jack.
Wouldn't dream of it, Jack.
[a view from behind reveals their fingers are crossed]

[from in the bag]
Me on vacation? On Christmas Eve?
Where are we taking him?
Where?
To Oogie Boogie, of course. There's no where in the whole world more comfortable than *that*. And Jack *said* to make him comfortable, didn't he?
Yes, he did.
Forgive me, Mr. Claus. I'm afraid I've made a terrible mess of your holiday.
Bumpy *sleigh*-ride... Jack. Next time you get the urge to take over someone else's holiday, I'd listen to *her*.
[points to Sally]
She's the only one who makes any sense around this insane asylum!
[walks away, muttering]
Skeletons, boogie men...
I hope there's still time.
To fix Christmas? Of course there is! I'm Santa Claus!
[flies out chimney]
How horrible our Christmas will be!
*No.*
[the Mayor switches to his upset face]
How *jolly*!
Oh. How *jolly* our Christmas will be.
Jack! Jack! We caught him.
[catching themselves]
We *got* him.
Perfect! Open it up. Quickly!
[opens it up to reveal the Easter bunny]
That's not Sandy Claws!
It isn't?
Who is it?

[the Easter bunny hops up a set of steps and up to the Behemouth, sniffing him - he points at it]
BUNNY!
[it leaps back into the covered tub, terrified]
Not Sandy Claws... Take him back!
We followed your instructions...
We went through the door...
Which door? There's more than one! Sandy Claws is behind the door shaped like *this*.
[shows Christmas cookie in shape of tree]
I *told* you!

[Lock and Shock fight, Jack buries his face in his hand and after a moment stretches out his jaw and screams]
AURR!
[they stop fighting and gasp with Barrel]

[to the Easter bunny]
I'm very sorry for the inconvenience, sir.
[to the henchmen]
Take *him* home first. And apologize again. Be careful with Sandy Claws when you fetch him. Treat him nicely.
Got it.
We'll get it right...
Next time.
Well well well. What have we here? Sandy Claws, huh? Ooo I'm really scared! So you're the one everybody's talking about?
[laughs]

[singing]
You're joking, you're joking/I can't believe my eyes/You're joking me, you've gotta be/ This can't be the right guy! He's ancient, he's ugly/ I don't know which is worse! I might just spit a seam now if I don't die laughing first!

[sings]
I sense there's something in the wind / That feels like tragedy's at hand. / And though I'd like to stand by him, / Can't shake this feeling that we have. / The worst is just around the bend. / And does he notice / My feelings for him? / And will he see / How much he means to me? / I think it's not to be.

Oh, the sound of rolling dice to me is music in the air, / 'cause I'm a gambling Boogie Man, although I don't play fair. / It's much more fun, I must confess, with lives on the line. / Not mine, of course, but yours, old boy, / now, that'll be just fine.
The job I have for you is top secret. It requires skill, craft, cunning, mis...
And we thought you didn't *like* us, Jack.

[singing]
Release me now or you'll have to face the dire consequences. / The children are expecting me, so please come to your senses.

[singing]
You're jokin', you're jokin'! / I can't believe my ears! / Would someone shut this fella up? / I'm drownin' in my tears! / It's funny, I'm laughing! / You really are too much. / And now, with your permission, / I'm going to do my stuff.
[snake dangles from his mouth]

[fearfully]
What are you going to do?
I'm gonna do the best I can!
[attempting to push Santa down the pipe]
I think he might be too big!
[she tries again, he groans]
No, he's not! If he can go down a chimney... he can fit...
[shoves]
down...
[shoves again]
...here!
[Santa slides down the pipe]
[to his new creation, as he inserts part of his own brain]
What a joy to think of all *we'll* have in common. *We'll* have conversations *worth* having.
Lunch!
Mm, what's this?
[sniffs]
Wormswort! Mmm...
[prepares to take a bite but then sniffs suspiciously]
...And frog's breath?

[innocently]
What's wrong? I thought you *liked* frog's breath.
Nothing's more suspicious than frog's breath! Until *you* taste it, I won't swallow a spoonful!
I'm not hungry.
[shrugs and in doing so pretends to accidentally knock over the spoon he holds up]
Oops!

[as she shoves the spoon aside on the floor and, still bent over, removes a slotted spoon from her sock]
You want me to starve! An old man like me who hardly has strength as it is! Me! To whom you owe your very *life*!
Oh, don't be silly!
[Dips the sifting spoon in the soup and pretends to taste it]
Mmmm! See? Scrumptious.

[singing]
Won't they be impressed, I am a ge-ni-us! See how I transform this old rat inTO a most deLIGHTful hat!

[singing]
I am the Clown with the tear-away face!
[Pulls face off]

[Demonic voice]
Here in a *flash* and gone without a trace!
[vanishes in a puff of smoke]

[singing]
I'm a master of fright, / and a deeeemon of light, / and I'll scare you right out of your pants. / To a guy in Kentucky / I'm Mister Unlucky / And I'm know thoughout England and France, / And since I am dead, / I can take off my head /
[does it]
to recite Shakespearean quotations. / No animal or man /
[puts it back on]
Can SCREAM like I can / With the fury of my recitations.
J-J-J-Jack! But they said you were dead. You must be - double dead!
I had the most terrible vision.
That's splendid!
No - it was about your Christmas. There was smoke... and fire!
my Sandy Claws outfit. I want you to make it.
Jack, please listen to me. It's going to be a disaster!
How could it be? Just follow the pattern!
[holds up design of outfit]
This part's red, the trim is white...
It's a mistake, Jack!
Now don't be modest. Who else is clever enough to make my Sandy Claws outfit?
Next!
I have every confidence in you.
But it seems wrong to me. Very wrong.

[singing]
What's this? What's this? There's color everywhere! What's this? There's white things in the air! What's this? I can't believe my eyes, I must be dreaming; wake up, Jack, this isn't fair! What's this?

[examining Jack in his newly-finished Santa suit]
You don't look like yourself, Jack. Not at all.
Isn't that wonderful? It couldn't be more wonderful!

[holds up the clipboard sketch of him]
But you're the Pumpkin King!
Not anymore!
[breks it over his knee]
I feel SO much better now!

[pulling a loose thread from his cuff]
Jack, I know you think something's missing, but -
[accidentally catches his finger]

[lightly]
Ow.
Sorry.
You're right. Something *is* missing. But what? I've got the beard... the coat... the boots... the belt...

[come in]
Jack! Jack! This time we found him!
This time we really did.
He sure is big, Jack!
And heavy!

[bursting out the bag]
Let me out!
[the Halloween citizens gasp in awe]
Sandy Claws - in person. What a pleasure to meet you.
[prepares to shake but then looks down when their HANDS touch]
Wh - ! Why, you have *hands*! You don't have claws at all!

[dazed]
Where am I?
Consider this a vacation, Santy. A reward. It's your turn to take it easy.
B-But there must be some mistake!
See that he's comfortable... Just a second, fellas! Of *course*! *That's* what I'm missing!
[takes Santa's hat]
B-But...
Thanks.
Hang on - you just can't -
[has the bag thrown over him again]
Hold on! Where are we going now?
[the henchmen leave with him]
Ho, ho, *ho*! No...
[monotone]
Ho, ho, ho. Ho...
This is worse than I thought. Much worse. I know!
[leaves to get fog juice]

[about Jack, who is missing]
I peeked behind the Cyclops' eye - I did! - But he wasn't there.

[singing]
And on a dark cold night, under full moonlight, he flies into the fog like a vulture in the sky!
[in a deeper tone]
And they call him, Sandy... Clawssss...!
Ashes to askes and dust to dust! Ohh... I'm feeling weak - with hunger! One more roll o'the dice oughta do it!
[places the dice in the skull shaker but receives a pair of ones]
WHAT? SNAKE-EYES!
[strikes the table hard enough to overturn them and get a larger number]

[after having his sack body ripped open]
Now look what you've done! My bugs! My bugs! My bugs!
'Here Lies Poor Old Jack'.
No, Zero. Down, boy... My, what a brilliant nose you have. The better to light my way! You're the head of the team, Zero!

[approaching with his foot stuck in a pumpkin]
I tromped through the pumpkin patch.
[to the Easter Bunny]
Bunny!

[sung]
Well, what the heck, I really did my best/And by God I really tasted something swell, that's right/And for a moment, why, I even touched the sky/And at least I left some stories they can tell, I did/And for the first time since I don't remember when/I felt like my old bony self again/And I, Jack, the Pumpkin King...

[spoken]
That's right. I AM THE PUMPKIN KING!

[sung]
And I just can't wait until next Halloween/'Cause I've got some new ideas that will really make them scream/And by God, I'm really gonna give it all my might!/
[spoken]
Uh-oh, I hope there's still time to set things right. Sandy Claws...

[singing]
You know, I think this Christmas thing is not as tricky as it seems! But why should they have all the fun? It should belong to anyone! Not anyone, in fact, but me! Why, I could make a Christmas tree! And there's not a reason I can find, I couldn't have a Christmastime! I bet I could improve it, too! And that's exactly what I'll do!
You've poisoned me for the last time, you wretched girl!

[singing]
Of course, I've been too close to see! The answer's right in front of me!
Say it once, say it twice, take a chance and roll the dice. Ride with the moon in the dead of night.
[singing]
[looking at a present Jack brought]
It's a bat!

[singing]
Will it bend?

[singing]
It's a rat!

[singing]
Will it break?

[singing]
Perhaps it's the head that I've found in the lake.
Nice work, Bone Daddy!
Mmmmm... an interesting reaction! But what does it mean?
Attacked by Christmas toys? That's strange, that's the second toy complaint we've had.
That's twice this month you've slipped deadly nightshade into my tea and run off.
Three times!
Sally! I need your help most of all.
You certainly do, Jack. I've had the most horrible vision!
That's splendid!

[singing]
Kidnap the Sandy Claws, / beat him with a stick, / lock him up for ninety years, / see what makes him tick.
We pick up an oversized sock, and hang it like this on the wall...
Oh, yes! Does it still have a foot?
Let me see, let me look.
Is it rotted and covered with gook?
Eureka! This year, Christmas will be - OURS!

[singing]
I say that we take a cannon, aim it at his door, and then, knock three times, and when he answers, Sandy Claws will be no more!

[singing]
You're so stupid! Think now! If we blow him up to smithereens, we may lose some pieces!

[singing]
And then Jack will beat us black and green!

[unwrapping Oogie Boogie]
How dare you treat my friend so shamefully!
Kidnap Mr. Sandy Claws?
I wanna do it.
Let's draw straws!
Jack said we should work together.
Three of a kind.
Birds of a feather.
Now and forever!
Release me fast or you will have to answer for this heinous act.
Are you a gambling man, Santa?

[singing]
What a splendid idea! This Christmas sounds fun. I fully endorse it -
[while shooing away a bat he switches his face to look unhappy]
let's try it at once!
The King of Halloween has been blown to smithereens! Skeleton Jack is now a pile of dust!
Pile of dust! Pile of dust! Skeleton Jack is a pile of dust!

[singing]
I wish my cohorts weren't so dumb.
*I'm* not the dumb one.
You're no fun!
Shut up!
Make me!

[singing with false pomp]
And I, *Jack*, the *Pump-kin King*, have grown so tired of the same old thing.
The imposter has been shot down, but there is still no sign of the real Santa Claus...
[fades off in the distance]
Maaasterrr... The plaaaannnsss!
Excellent, Igor.
[Throws him a doggy treat]

[of Jack's disappearance]
This has never happened before!
It's suspicious.
It's peculiar.
It's scary!

[upon discovering Christmas Town]
Christmas Town? Hmmmm...
Terrible news, folks! The worst tragedy of our time! Jack has been blown to smithereens!

[of Jack]
There he is!
Alive!
Just like we said!

[throws Jack a ladder]
Grab ahold, my boy!
